premises: A number is even or it is odd but not both at the same time
conclusions: If a number is not odd, then it is even
incorrect conclusions: If a number is even, then it is odd
If a number is odd, then it is even

premises: A function is continuous or it is not differentiable but not both at the same time
conclusions: If a function is differentiable, then it is continuous
incorrect conclusions: If a function is continuous, then it is not differentiable
If a function is not differentiable, then it is continuous

premises: A matrix is invertible or it has no inverse but not both at the same time
conclusions: If a matrix has an inverse, then it is invertible
incorrect conclusions: If a matrix is invertible, then it has an inverse
If a matrix has no inverse, then it is invertible
